summary: Comprehensive backend testing of Banner Management System for Paridhaan Creations e-commerce platform. All 20 tests passed (100% success rate). Tested public banner endpoints, admin-protected endpoints, static file serving, and banner scheduling features.

tests: GET /api/banners returns active banners - PASS (13 banners)
GET /api/banners?banner_type=header filters correctly - PASS (4 header banners)
GET /api/banners?banner_type=footer filters correctly - PASS (3 footer banners)
GET /api/banners?banner_type=side filters correctly - PASS (4 side banners)
GET /api/banners/all requires admin auth (returns 403 without auth) - PASS
GET /api/banners/all works with admin auth - PASS
POST /api/upload/image requires admin auth (returns 403 without auth) - PASS
POST /api/upload/image works with admin auth - PASS
POST /api/banners requires admin auth (returns 403 without auth) - PASS
POST /api/banners works with admin auth - PASS
GET /api/uploads/{filename} returns 404 for nonexistent files - PASS
Banners with future start_date do NOT appear in public API - PASS
Banners with past end_date do NOT appear in public API - PASS
Banners within valid schedule appear in public API - PASS
Banners without schedule (null dates) appear in public API - PASS
All scheduled banners visible in admin /api/banners/all - PASS
Type filter respects scheduling rules - PASS

seed_data_creation: Used existing admin user (priyankg3@gmail.com) and created new session token for testing. Test banners created during tests were cleaned up automatically.
context_for_next_testing_agent: Banner management system fully functional. All public endpoints (GET /api/banners with type filters) working. Admin-protected endpoints (GET /api/banners/all, POST /api/upload/image, POST /api/banners) properly secured with 403 response for unauthorized access. Static file serving at /api/uploads/{filename} working. Banner scheduling feature (start_date/end_date) correctly filters banners in public API while showing all in admin endpoint. 13 existing banners in database (4 header, 4 side, 3 footer, 2 promotional).
